main event: Pilot of MATS 20996 sighted a large bright explosion of small objects over the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object was observed for a few minutes in front of the aircraft at an altitude of approximately 7,000 feet.
The sighting occurred at an aircraft altitude of 5,000 feet, with the object appearing just above a low cloud layer.
The location of the sighting was at coordinates 13-46N 144-20E.
The pilot reported the object as a large bright explosion of small objects.
The sighting was evaluated as having the characteristics of a meteor observation.
sighted object: large bright explosion of small objects
